news_header: Central Florida's housing inventory rises for the ninth consecutive month, while interest rates drop, creating a more balanced market.
news_text: In September 2024, Central Florida's housing inventory reached 11,560, a 0.4% increase from August and a 71.1% rise from September 2023, marking the highest levels since September 2015. Interest rates fell to 5.9%, the lowest since August 2022, while homes averaged 58 days on the market, up from 57 days in August and significantly longer than 41 days in September 2023. The median home price decreased to $380,000 from $384,500 in August. Overall sales declined by 15.3%, with pending sales down by 1.9% and new listings decreasing by 8.5%. Rose Kemp, President of the Orlando Regional Realtor Association, noted that lower interest rates and increased inventory are leading to a more balanced housing market, encouraging buyers to pursue homeownership.
